data.title: Working At Eyemart Express: Company Overview and Culture
data.meta_description: Learn about working at Eyemart Express from employee reviews and detailed data on culture, salaries, demographics, management, financial, and more.
data.text:
Eyemart Express overview

Industry

Pharmacies and Personal Care Stores

Revenue

Employees

7,500

Founded In

Organization Type

Private

In 1990, Dr. Barnes opened the first Eyemart Express. In the 20-plus years that they have been in business, they have helped millions improve their vision in 34 states-151 locations and growing-with an emphasis on providing attractive eyewear with remarkable value and affordability. Eyemart Express ranks number 7 as the nation's largest optical retailer. We also operate under the names Vision4Less, VisionMart Express and Eyewear Express. In their infancy, they were not much more than a functional optical operation, spending little energy on aesthetics. From the store signs to the displays, they took the minimalist approach. However, as they continued to grow so did their style. Their waiting areas are comfortable and their floors have significant space to browse through their impressive frame selection. Polished walnut display cases replaced folding tables. Eyemart Express is the 7th largest optical retail in the United States with over 151 locations in 34 states. In addition to the Eyemart Express name, the company operates as Vision4Less, VisionMart Express and Eyewear Express as well as the new eyemartexpress.com. Eyemart Express, Vision4Less, VisionMart Express and Eyewear Express take the phrase "Out-friendly the competition" to heart. When their customers purchase eyeglasses from them, they do as much as possible to impress upon them their concept of quality, service and value. Their customers are their guests and they aim to put their best foot forward when you visit them, whether it's in the store or online. Eyemart Express's frames are categorized according to gender and price for your convenience. Our product line also includes designers such as Nike, Guess, Fendi. Calvin Klein, Armani and more. We also pride ourselves on the free Home Try-on service where you may pick out that perfect eyewear in the privacy of your very own home! Eyemart Express outgrew its initial, bare bones style but not its core commitment: their eyeglasses are still priced every bit as fairly as they were in the beginning. They focus on improving your vision and making you happy; the two are unquestionably linked at Eyemart Express. Their retail section and lab work in conjunction like a well-oiled machine, giving you the best value on the market.

Founded in 1990, Eyemart Express is an established company that loves to hire graduates from Austin Community College, with 9.8% of its employees having attended Austin Community College. Eyemart Express has established itself as a great place to work in Texas, and it is number 15 on Zippia's list of Best Companies to Work for in Farmers Branch, TX.The average employee at Eyemart Express makes $35,636 per year. Pay at Eyemart Express is significantly lower than some of its highest paying competitors, like Discover Vision, SVS Vision, and Stitch Fix, which pay $50,740, $49,624, and $48,627, respectively.

A large health care company with 7,500 employees and an annual revenue of $158.0M, Eyemart Express is headquartered in Texas.
